thread.title: 36 Sinfully Fun Pictures Mardi Gras Over Years
thread.title_full: 36 Sinfully Fun Pictures From Mardi Gras Over The Years

author: Gabriel H. Sanchez
title: 36 Sinfully Fun Pictures Mardi Gras Over Years
text:
View this image ›
Three Lions / Getty Images A float celebrating the life of John James Audubon, an American naturalist and artist, passes a cheering crowd at Mardi Gras in New Orleans, circa 1956.
ID: 10586104 Mara Vivat / Getty Images
Mara Vivat / Getty Images
 A woman (left) dances in a hula skirt in a Mardi Gras parade amid men in costumes, circa 1955. A group of Mardi Gras princesses (right) ride a parade float in their formals, circa 1955.
ID: 10586130 View this image ›
William Vandivert / Getty Images A trio of men in women’s lingerie stand among the crowd gathered for Mardi Gras celebrations, 1938.
ID: 10586073 View this image ›
Bettmann Archive / Getty Images A young woman tosses beaded necklaces to the crowds below in 1969.
ID: 10561600 Bettmann Archive / Getty Images
Bettmann Archive / Getty Images
 A woman and man sport colorful face paint on Fat Tuesday, 1969.
ID: 10561684 View this image ›
David Redfern / Redferns A high school marching band makes its way down Bourbon Street during Fat Tuesday festivities, circa 1970.
ID: 10584421 View this image ›
Tim Boxer / Getty Images A float carrying a cannon rides down the street with a sign that reads “Hurrah! The War Is Over,” 1973.
ID: 10586854 View this image ›
Ernst Haas / Getty Images Masked figures on a float are greeted by the crowd in a Mardi Gras procession in 1961.
ID: 10586458 View this image ›
Ernst Haas / Getty Images A man in the street takes a swig from a bottle during Mardi Gras, 1979.
ID: 10584468 Ernst Haas / Getty Images
Ernst Haas / Getty Images
 A reveler (left) appears naked to the waist with some help from a rubber torso in 1979. A woman in a brightly colored dress and headscarf dances barefoot with a snake around her neck in 1978.
ID: 10584493 View this image ›
Ernst Haas / Getty Images A pair of men sport felt fedoras, red shirts, and rosettes as part of their Mardi Gras costumes in 1979.
ID: 10586888 View this image ›
Bettmann Archive / Getty Images A beautiful and creative float resembling an astronaut moves down the street at a Mardi Gras parade, 1972.
ID: 10584437 View this image ›
Visions Of America / Getty Images A group of friends in colorful costumes join in the festivities in 1988.
ID: 10585647 Visions Of America / Getty Images
Visions Of America / Getty Images
 Two young girls (left) enjoy the Mardi Gras parade in 1988, while a woman (right) poses for a picture with her face painted as a cat.
ID: 10586916 View this image ›
Bettmann / Bettmann Archive Zulu parade floats make their way down Canal Street as the first parade of Mardi Gras day inches its way through the Central Business District in 1987.
ID: 10586898 View this image ›
Visions Of America / Getty Images Joyous spectators cheer on the floats and reach for beads during the Mardi Gras parade in 1988.
ID: 10585623 Mitchel Osborne / Getty Images
Visions of America / UIG / Getty Images
 Elaborately costumed revelers celebrating in 1988.
ID: 10585663 View this image ›
Bettmann / Bettmann Archive The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, a San Francisco gay activist group, show off the gold-wrapped condoms they distributed to Mardi Gras attendees in 1987.
ID: 10584509 View this image ›
Bevil Knapp / Getty Images A court jester float makes its way down the Mardi Gras parade route in 1994.
ID: 10586017 View this image ›
Andrew Lichtenstein / Getty Images An unidentified man shares Polaroids he’s collected of women who have pulled up their shirts in exchange for carnival beads thrown from the French Quarter balconies, 1992.
ID: 10585705 View this image ›
Leon Morris / Redferns An unidentified band member leads participates in an energetic precession during the festivities in 2000.
ID: 10586585 View this image ›
Mario Tama / Getty Images A man on a Bourbon Street balcony offers beads to women below in 2005.
ID: 10586040 View this image ›
Chris Graythen / Getty Images A group of revelers with cameras wait to capture a picture of a topless woman on Bourbon Street in 2007.
ID: 10585793 View this image ›
Robyn Beck / AFP / Getty Images A man cleans the street outside his family’s bar on Bourbon Street the day after Mardi Gras, 2006.
ID: 10585832 View this image ›
Robyn Beck / AFP / Getty Images A girl receives a toy from a passing float during the first day of Mardi Gras celebrations in 2006.
ID: 10585912 View this image ›
Mario Tama / Getty Images Young Mardi Gras “Indians” participants join in the annual Super Sunday second line parade in 2008 in New Orleans, Louisiana. Mardi Gras Indians are comprised of African-Americans of inner city New Orleans’ and their numbers have dwindled due to many members being scattered across the country following Hurricane Katrina. The secretive Indian groups began appearing in the city in the 1880’s as an homage to the Native Americans who sheltered runaway slaves.
ID: 10585859 View this image ›
Mario Tama / Getty Images Second Chief “Lil Bo” performs with the Wild Magnolias Mardi Gras Indian gang in the French Quarter during festivities in 2006.
ID: 10607608 View this image ›
Erika Goldring / Getty Images The Orpheus Leviathan dragon float, with smoke and fiber-optic lights, rolls down Napoleon Avenue in the 2015 Krewe of Orpheus Parade.
ID: 10585979 View this image ›
Jonathan Bachman / Getty Images People pack Bourbon Street during Mardi Gras in 2016.
ID: 10586627 See more pictures of Mardi Gras through the years at Getty Images . ID: 10607295
